other_tests.procedure_name: Laser Doppler retinal blood circulation study
other_tests.findings: Decreased venous blood flow in the left eye; diameter of left superotemporal and inferotemporal veins enlarged and average centerline blood velocity was 8.7 mm/second (75% below normal).
other_tests.changes_over_time: After intervention, visual symptoms and retinal appearance improved, and retinal blood flow normalized. However, worsened visual symptoms with increased paracentral scotomata and occasional blurriness occurred one week after discharge. Further decrease in venous blood velocity to 4.7 mm/second and increased tortuosity noted before visual symptoms improved again.

other_tests.findings: Left retinal venous thrombosis with scotoma; visual acuity was 20/20 in the right eye and 20/25 in the left eye; normal anterior segments.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial visual symptoms improved with a decrease in the size of the scotoma during anticoagulation therapy. However, symptoms worsened shortly after starting warfarin treatment, but subsequently improved over the next 4 months.
